title: Determine Sample Means
question_text:
Determine which of the situations involve(s) calculations of sample means.

I. Survey $15\text{ people}$ and define $X$ as the number of people who eat fast food every day. II. It has been determined that $29\text{ students}$ out of the $35$ in Joe’s calculus class are passing. III. In a survey of $15$ high school females, the average weight was $117\text{ lbs}$.
solution:
Statements I and II are incorrect; the former deals with the binomial distribution, and each uses “yes” or “no” answers to deal with proportions.

Statement III is correct; this deals with sample means, where the answer to the survey is a number and not a “yes” or “no” answer.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
